translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

In view of the copy of the official letter enclosed, Your Excellency shall see that Mr. Prado explains; more than 4 days ago he had already ordered Mr. Manuel Alves Manuel Alvares to proceed to the vicinity of Ibirocaí to join Major Carneiro, who was there with 50 men, already waiting for this very purpose, leaving Captain Fortunato with 20 men in Santa Ana, and until today nothing has been accomplished; I also sent official orders to the commanders who had meetings, also to join the same major, an officer whom, out of necessity, I resorted to, he not being exempt from answering for the crime he committed; and since until now none have arrived, and in view of the official letter, I shall have to march already with the men I could gather, which shall be Your Excellency’s concern.

God keep Your Excellency  
Barracks at Alegrete, November 22, 1837.  
Most Illustrious Sir João Antônio da Silveira  
Colonel and Commander of the Right Division  
José Inácio da Silva Abreu  
Lieutenant-Colonel Interim Commander of the Frontier.
